title: HTML FOR BEGINNERS
requirements:

bulletPoints.content:
A browser like the one you are using currently to view this :) . 
 A code editor , VS Code is prefered. 
 Install Live server and Prettifier extensions.

The front end deals with the "front" of a website or application, meaning its design and coding that keep the website working properly.
The back end, however, refers to everything on the server-side of a website or application, such as important data.
 A full stack developer is a programmer who works within software development and is knowledgeable in both the front-end and back-end of an application.

subHeading.content:
HTML :  Its the structure of the website. Used to define the layout of the webpage.
 CSS : To animate and style the layouts and contents like the font, shape of a picture and so on.
 JavaScript(JS) : To add fucntionaility to the website, to make components respond in a website , like increasing the no.of likes on click of a button and displaying the information based on user logged in. Unlike CSS and HTML this is a programming language.

bulletPoints.content:
Learn HTML and CSS 
JavaScript
Frameworks : Frameworks and libraries have reusable codes to make the development faster and easier For example : reactJS, Angular, Vue
Version Control System: These are used to keep track of project history while working on it as a team with many contributors or just you
Git is the most popular and the best version control system

sectionBlocks.heading: How the Web Works
sectionBlocks.description: The web address entered in a browser is URL (Uniform resource locator). Such as https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=dQw4w9WgXcQ .

bulletPoints.header: As the name suggests it locates the resource, the resource could be any of the folowing

subHeading.content:
The Client requests the server and the server provides the resource the requests message is based on a protocol(HTTP or HTTPS)
HTTPS is HTTP with encryption and hence is more secure. It encrypts the messages exchanged between the client and server.

moreData: When a url is entered in the browser it requests the resource from the computer the url targets to.
The browser is the client and the target computer is the server.

miniCodeblock.code:
GET /index.html HTTP/1.1
Host: www.sampleweb.com
Accept-language: en-us
miniCodeblock.description: Client is requesting to GET a page INDEX.HTML of the host www.sampleweb.com using HTTP version 1.1 using the client language english-US

miniCodeblock.code:
HTTP/1.1 200 OK 
DATE: 1 JAN 2021 09:00
Content-Type: text/html
<!DOCTYPE html>
<html>
.....
</html>
miniCodeblock.description:
Version of http used : 1.1 , status code (200 OK) which means successful
Date and time of response : 1 Jan 2021 09:00
type of content server is sending to client : text/htmlThe requested resource , in this case its a html file.
This html file may contains links or urls to othr resources such as web elements or images , once these resources are requested and recieved the browser renders the webpage.

bulletPoints.header: Follow these steps to make a new webpage :
bulletPoints.content:
Create a new folder and open the folder on the code editor.
Make a file with the extension of .html.
Make a file with the extension of .css
Use the live server extension which appears on the bottom right, or right click and choose go live

subHeading.content: The body of the HTML file begins with <!DOCTYPE html>.

subHeading.header: HTML has a head and body.
subHeading.content:
Head gives browser the info of the page
Title,styling files etc.
Body contains the layout and all the contents of the website thats visible to the client or user.

Most of the HTML tags have an opening and closing tag.
<tag_name>content</tag_name>
Self closing tags can be used instead of such as some frameworks dont support tags without a closing tag.
Example of self closing tags : </br>, </img>

bulletPoints.content:
charset : Used to define the character set used , UTF-8 Represents most of the popluar formats
viewport : The visible area of the webpage
keywords : For better targeting of the webpage on searching on browsers
description : Description of the webpage is shown in the search result page of a browser

codeBlock.code:
<head>
<meta charset='UTF-8'>
<meta http-equiv='X-UA-Compatible' content='IE=edge'>
<meta name='viewport' content='width=device-width, initial-scale=1.0'>
 <meta name='keywords' content='Learning HTML,CSS'>
<meta name='description' content='this appears on the search engine results as description'>
<title>Document</title>
</head>
